intro: Artanthe churumayu, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and is often found growing in rocky or alpine environments. It is adapted to cold climates and requires well-drained soil to thrive. Artanthe churumayu is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler regions.
